description: First attested in the 16th century. From Medieval Latin afforēstō, from Latin ad (“towards”) + forēsta (“forest”).

verbs.description: afforest (third-person singular simple present afforests, present participle afforesting, simple past and past participle afforested)

examples: After we leave the quarry, we intend to afforest the land and turn it into a nature reserve.
